definition: vast, with no clear boundary/fig. hazy/indistinct/unclear/confused

sentences.english: Very uninterest hesitate life and mentally stupefied are following me.
sentences.chinese: 生活很无趣彷徨和迷茫伴随着我。

sentences.english: Walking through the crowded street, we often feels very mixed-up about our life.
sentences.chinese: 走在人流匆匆的马路中，常常感到迷茫。

sentences.english: His future was uncertain, but he did not believe it could be unhappier than his past.
sentences.chinese: 他对将来仍一片迷茫，但他相信会比过去过得开心。

sentences.english: My eyes see nothing but misery; I need to see your sweet smile.
sentences.chinese: 我的眼中除了迷茫别无它物，我要见你的笑靥。

sentences.english: Where left and right agree is that America feels adrift right now.
sentences.chinese: 左派和右派都认同的一点是美国现在处于迷茫期。

sentences.english: He looked at me in blank amazement.
sentences.chinese: 他带着迷茫惊诧的神情望着我。

sentences.english: The figure slowed to a stop and stood there, lost and dejected.
sentences.chinese: 他慢慢地停下来，然后站在那里，迷茫而沮丧。

sentences.english: Tude has thought of Dai Wangshu plaintive confused as to which the Dream of the Rain Lane.
sentences.chinese: 突地又想起了戴望舒的那条如梦般凄婉迷茫的雨巷了。

sentences.english: Or do you live continually with distractions and confusion?
sentences.chinese: 或者您是否一直活在困扰和迷茫中？

sentences.english: I see right through that Xiaoxiang. All he ever he ever does is give these formal excuses.
sentences.chinese: 我现在真的感觉有点迷茫，不知道下一步该怎么走。

sentences.english: Finally, I sniff speculation in the air.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我已经嗅出了迷茫在空中投机的味道。

sentences.english: I love the winter sun spreading out behind the morning haze.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢冬天的阳光，在迷茫的晨雾中展开。

sentences.english: Wow, I feel a little bit lost. Maybe I need to think about it more.
sentences.chinese: 真还有些迷茫了，也许我还需要更多的思考吧。

sentences.english: The crossover steps in cumbia dancing opens opportunities for turns and spins.
sentences.chinese: 在跳Cumbia的交叉步打开迷茫的机遇和旋转。

sentences.english: Let us re-examine ourselves, we need to arrangement our live.
sentences.chinese: 让我们从新审核一下自己，从新安排我们迷茫的生活。

sentences.english: A dream full of nameless gloom.

definition: to pace back and forth/to hesitate/to be indecisive
to lose (sth)/to drop (sth)/to feel a sense of loss/frustrated/disappointment/loss
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
anxious and perplexed/uneasy and confused/suspicious and fearful
not knowing what to do next/at a loose end
